translated: Brahmins are of three types from the perspective of lineage, name, and accomplishment.

analyzed: don gyi skabs 'dir sgrub pa bram ze la 'dod de bya ba byas shing mi dge ba'i chos thams cad bsal bas na yang dag par song ba'o //

original: yang na slob pa dang mi slob pa dag ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dag las rnam par rgyal bas na lam rgyal ba'i dge sbyong zhes bya ste /

translated: Or else, the terms ‚Äúone who has conquered the path‚Äù and ‚Äúone who has conquered the bad states‚Äù refer to the learner and the non-learner, respectively, because they have conquered the mental afflictions that are to be abandoned by the paths of seeing and cultivation.

original: de'i phyir rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa la sbyar bar bya'o //

analyzed: de la rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang phyir mi 'ong ba dag ni yang dag par song ba'o //
translated: Among them, the stream-enterer, the once-returner, and the non-returner are those who have gone to the very end of the path of purification.

original: de dag ni rgyu la zhugs pa gsum dang / dgra bcom pa'i rgyu la zhugs pa ni yang dag par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni rgyu la zhugs pa gsum dang / dgra bcom pa'i rgyu la zhugs pa ni yang dag par zhugs pa'o //
translated: The three who have entered the cause are those who have entered the path of the once-returner, the path of the non-returner, and the path of the arhat.üîΩThe one who has entered the cause of the arhat is one who has entered the very end of the path of purification.

original: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa ni dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa ni dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: The one who abides in the result of the arhat is the arhat.

original: dgra bcom pa'i yon tan gang zhe na /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i yon tan gang zhe na /
translated: What are the qualities of the arhat?

original: 'jig rten rig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten rig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: They are the knowledge of the world, and so on.

original: lha'i mig gi mngon par shes pa dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / zag pa zag pa'i mngon par shes pa ni 'jig rten rig pa'o //üîΩde las @226a * //

translated: The supernormal knowledge of the divine eye, the supernormal knowledge of the cognition of the passing away and arising of beings, and the supernormal knowledge of the destruction of the impurities are the knowledge of the world.

analyzed: bzlog pa ni gang zag tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa dal ba'i dus ni gcig ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa'i chos gang zhe na thog mar dge ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: What is the Dharma taught by the Tathagata? It is said to be virtuous in the beginning, middle, and end.

original: chos kyi yon tan gyi rnam grangs ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: bshad par bya ba dang / khong du chud par bya ba'o //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: ston pa'i dam chos rnam gnyis te //

analyzed: de lta bas na bshad par bya ba'i chos bstan par bya ba ni thog mar dge ba /

original: bar du dge ba /
analyzed: bar du dge ba /

original: tha mar dge ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: tha mar dge ba zhes bya ste /

analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa ston pas thog mar dge ba ste /

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa yin te /

translated: Possessing indivisible emptiness and compassion is the superior intention.

original: / sems bskyed de zhes bya ba ni smon pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: / sems bskyed de zhes bya ba ni smon pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The phrase having generated the mind refers to the aspiration aspect.

original: spyi'i don la gnas skabs kyi stobs kyis dgos pa bye brag tu bstan pas na dad pa yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: spyi'i don la gnas skabs kyi stobs kyis dgos pa bye brag tu bstan pas na dad pa yin zhes bya'o //
translated: Faith is so called because it is the cause of the purification of the mind-stream, and because it is the basis of the special need for the general meaning, by the power of the occasion.

original: de'i phyir dad pa bstan par bya ba ni dang ba mang zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir dad pa bstan par bya ba ni dang ba mang zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the teaching of faith is that it is the abundance of clarity, etc.

original: byed pa dang / yul dang / ngo bo nyid dang / phan yon yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byed pa dang / yul dang / ngo bo nyid dang / phan yon yang rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand the activity, the object, the nature, and the benefit.

original: de la byed pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la byed pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Therein, the activity is threefold:

original: dang ba'i byed pa dang / 'dod pa'i byed pa dang / yid ches pa'i byed pa'o //
analyzed: dang ba'i byed pa dang / 'dod pa'i byed pa dang / yid ches pa'i byed pa'o //
translated: the activity of clarity, the activity of desire, and the activity of confidence.

original: de la dang ba'i byed pa ni nor bu chu dang byed ltar rgyud kyi rnyog pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de la dang ba'i byed pa ni nor bu chu dang byed ltar rgyud kyi rnyog pa med pa ste /
translated: The activity of clarity is the absence of turbidity in the mind-stream, like a crystal.

original: phyir zhing 'phags pa rnams la lta 'dod pa dang / dam pa'i chos nyan par 'dod pa'o //üîΩde la dang ba @228a * //
analyzed: phyir zhing 'phags pa rnams la lta 'dod pa dang / dam pa'i chos nyan par 'dod pa'o // de la dang ba @228a * //
translated: It is the desire to see the noble ones again and again, and the desire to hear the true Dharma.

original: ma yin pa ni rtag tu bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin pa ni rtag tu bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therein, the absence of clarity is due to the constant cultivation of the opposite.

original: 'phags pa ni las dang nyon mongs pa las ring du song ba ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa ni las dang nyon mongs pa las ring du song ba ste /
translated: The noble ones are those who have gone far from karma and the afflictions.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang / de'i dge 'dun dag go //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang / de'i dge 'dun dag go //
translated: The true Dharma is the Buddha, the Perfectly Enlightened One, and his Sangha.

original: dam pa ni gang zag de dag ste /
analyzed: dam pa ni gang zag de dag ste /
translated: The holy ones are those persons.

original: de dag gis spyad pa'i phyir dam pa'i chos so //
analyzed: de dag gis spyad pa'i phyir dam pa'i chos so //
translated: The true Dharma is that which they practice.

original: 'dod pa'i byed pa ni ser sna med pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i byed pa ni ser sna med pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The functions of desire are non-greed, etc.

original: thob pa dang spangs pa la dmigs pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i rgyu lam gyi bden pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi rgyu kun 'byung la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: thob pa dang spangs pa la dmigs pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i rgyu lam gyi bden pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi rgyu kun 'byung la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The truth of the path is the cause of attaining nirvana, and the truth of origination is the cause of suffering, because they are, respectively, the objects of the attainment of nirvana and the objects of the abandonment of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu kun 'byung spangs pa'i phyir ser sna med ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu kun 'byung spangs pa'i phyir ser sna med ces bya ba ste /
translated: Non-greed is the cause of the abandonment of the truth of origination, which is the cause of suffering,

original: ser sna dang 'chal pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa dag ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ser sna dang 'chal pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa dag ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because greed, immorality, etc., are the causes of suffering.üîΩGenerosity, etc., are the cause of attaining the truth of the path, which is the cause of nirvana,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu lam gyi bden pa thob par bya ba'i phyir lhug par gtong ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu lam gyi bden pa thob par bya ba'i phyir lhug par gtong ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: because they are the cause of the attainment of nirvana.

original: ma chags pa'i ngo bo nyid la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug ni lam du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma chags pa'i ngo bo nyid la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug ni lam du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The six perfections such as giving, which have the nature of nonattachment, etc., are considered to be the path.

original: de la lhug par gtong ba ni sbyin pa dang 'bras bu ma 'brel ba ste mya ngan las 'das pa bsngo ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la lhug par gtong ba ni sbyin pa dang 'bras bu ma 'brel ba ste mya ngan las 'das pa bsngo ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Of these, relaxed giving is giving without regard to results, because it is dedicated to nirvana.

original: lag pa brkyang ba ni gus pa dang rgya cher rab tu sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: lag pa brkyang ba ni gus pa dang rgya cher rab tu sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Openhanded giving is giving respectfully and on a vast scale.

original: gtong ba la dga' ba ni snga rol dang de'i tshe dang byin zin nas yi rang ba dang / dang ba dang / 'gyod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gtong ba la dga' ba ni snga rol dang de'i tshe dang byin zin nas yi rang ba dang / dang ba dang / 'gyod pa med pa'o //
translated: Joyful giving is delighting in giving before, during, and after giving, being clear about it, and having no regrets.

original: sbyin pa mi 'chad par byed pa ni gcig tu chos dang bab col ma yin pas longs spyod sgrub ste dus dus su yang dang yang du sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po yongs su gtong ba'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa mi 'chad par byed pa ni gcig tu chos dang bab col ma yin pas longs spyod sgrub ste dus dus su yang dang yang du sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po yongs su gtong ba'o //
translated: Giving without interruption is giving again and again at the appropriate times, by means of wealth that has been acquired by means that are in accordance with the Dharma and not at random.

original: gtong ba phun sum tshogs pa ni sbyin gnas dag la 'bul ba'o //
analyzed: gtong ba phun sum tshogs pa ni sbyin gnas dag la 'bul ba'o //
translated: Perfect giving is giving to worthy recipients.

original: sbyin pa 'gyed par dga' ba ni dus dus su pha dang ma dang bu dang bran pho dang bran mo la sogs pa la kun 'gyed pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa 'gyed par dga' ba ni dus dus su pha dang ma dang bu dang bran pho dang bran mo la sogs pa la kun 'gyed pa'o //
translated: The joy of giving is the joy of giving to one's father, mother, children, servants, etc. from time to time.

original: yang na sbyin pa rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: yang na sbyin pa rnam pa drug ste /
translated: Or else, giving is of six types:

original: mi rten pa dang // dga' ba dang / yang dang yang du sbyin pa dang / snod du gyur pa la sbyin pa dang / yongs su gzung ba sbyin pa dang / 'khor la sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: mi rten pa dang // dga' ba dang / yang dang yang du sbyin pa dang / snod du gyur pa la sbyin pa dang / yongs su gzung ba sbyin pa dang / 'khor la sbyin pa ste /
translated: giving without dependence, giving with joy, giving again and again, giving to those who are worthy recipients, giving with one's own hand, and giving to the Sa·πÖgha.

original: de ltar sbyin pa dang / gang la sbyin pa'i dbang du byas nas lhug par gtong ba la sogs pa rnams su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar sbyin pa dang / gang la sbyin pa'i dbang du byas nas lhug par gtong ba la sogs pa rnams su rig par bya'o //
translated: Giving should be understood in this way, according to the person who gives and the one to whom he gives, as well as according to the object given.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang mi srid pas lhug par gtong ba'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang mi srid pas lhug par gtong ba'o //
translated: It is a gift of freedom, since it is not subject to the power of others.

original: mi 'gyod pas na dga' ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'gyod pas na dga' ba'o //
translated: It is a gift with joy, since it is free from regret.

original: gus pa dang ldan pas mchod sbyin no //
analyzed: gus pa dang ldan pas mchod sbyin no //
translated: It is a gift with respect, since it is free from contempt for the recipient.

original: lus dang longs spyod dang dge ba gtong bas gtong ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang longs spyod dang dge ba gtong bas gtong ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: It is a perfect gift, since it gives away one's body, possessions, and virtues.

original: rjes su dga' @228b bas 'gyed pa la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dga' @228b bas 'gyed pa la dga' ba'o //
translated: It is a gift of joy, since one rejoices at the prospect of giving.

original: gtong ba'i tshe na khong khro ba med pa'o //
analyzed: gtong ba'i tshe na khong khro ba med pa'o //
translated: When giving, there is no anger.

original: 'bras bu 'dod pa'i re ba med pas rnyog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'dod pa'i re ba med pas rnyog pa med pa'o //
translated: There is no disturbance, because there is no expectation of a reward.

original: yang na pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis zin pa ste /
analyzed: yang na pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis zin pa ste /
translated: Or else, it is embraced by the six perfections.

original: de la sbyin pa'i sbyin pa ni lhug par gtong ba'o //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa'i sbyin pa ni lhug par gtong ba'o //
translated: Of these, the giving of giving is the giving of what is in abundance.

original: tshul khrims ni dga' ba dang gus pa'i mchog sbyin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni dga' ba dang gus pa'i mchog sbyin no //
translated: Morality is the giving of the highest joy and respect.

original: brtson 'grus ni gtong ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni gtong ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Exertion is the perfection of giving.

original: bzod pa ni dga' ba dang khong khro ba med pa'o //
analyzed: bzod pa ni dga' ba dang khong khro ba med pa'o //
translated: Patience is the joy and absence of anger.

original: bsam gtan dang shes rab kyis zin pas na rnyog pa med pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang shes rab kyis zin pas na rnyog pa med pa ste /
translated: Concentration and wisdom are the absence of disturbance.

original: de ltar na sbyin pa ji lta ba bzhin du tshul khrims kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na sbyin pa ji lta ba bzhin du tshul khrims kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa rig par bya ste /
translated: Thus, the giving of morality, etc. should be understood in the same way as giving.

original: 'dir ni mtshon par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni mtshon par rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the latter is to be known as an illustration.

original: yid ches pa'i byed pa bstan pa ni las dang las kyi rnam par smin pa la yid ches pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yid ches pa'i byed pa bstan pa ni las dang las kyi rnam par smin pa la yid ches pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The demonstration of the function of confidence is stated in the verse beginning with ‚Äúconfidence in action and the evolution of action.‚Äù

original: de la yis ches pa la sogs pa gsum ni som nyi med pa la sogs pa gsum dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la yis ches pa la sogs pa gsum ni som nyi med pa la sogs pa gsum dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The three, excess, etc., are to be applied to the three, absence of doubt, etc.

original: yang na mi phyed pas yid ches par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na mi phyed pas yid ches par bya'o //
translated: Or else, one should believe through non-division.

original: nges par 'dzin pas mos pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'dzin pas mos pa'o //
translated: One should be convinced through definite apprehension.

original: bye brag phyed pas rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bye brag phyed pas rtogs pa'o //
translated: One should understand through discrimination.

original: thos pa'i tshe som nyi med pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa'i tshe som nyi med pa'o //
translated: At the time of hearing, there is no doubt.

original: bsam pa'i tshe the tshom med pa'o //üîΩbsgom pa'i tshe yid gnyis med pa'o zhes kha cig 'dod do //
analyzed: bsam pa'i tshe the tshom med pa'o // bsgom pa'i tshe yid gnyis med pa'o zhes kha cig 'dod do //
translated: At the time of reflection, there is no uncertainty.üîΩAt the time of cultivation, there is no ambivalence.

original: la la dag ni sbyor ba la sogs pa gsum du som nyi med pa la sogs pa yin no zhes so //
analyzed: la la dag ni sbyor ba la sogs pa gsum du som nyi med pa la sogs pa yin no zhes so //
translated: Some believe that at the time of application, etc., there is no doubt, etc.

original: lus can rnams kyis las dag ni //
analyzed: lus can rnams kyis las dag ni //
translated: The actions of embodied beings

original: bskal pa brgyar yang chud mi za //
analyzed: bskal pa brgyar yang chud mi za //
translated: do not perish even after a hundred aeons.

original: tshogs shing dus la bab pa na //
analyzed: tshogs shing dus la bab pa na //
translated: When the assemblage and the occasion are present,

original: 'bras bu nyid du 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid du 'gyur ba yin //
translated: they will certainly bear fruit.

original: zhes gnyen pos ma bcos par zad par mi 'gyur bas chud mi za'o //
analyzed: zhes gnyen pos ma bcos par zad par mi 'gyur bas chud mi za'o //
translated: Since they do not perish through exhaustion without being modified by an antidote, they do not perish.

original: chud mi za ba ci zhig gnod //
analyzed: chud mi za ba ci zhig gnod //
translated: What is the harm if they do not perish?

original: nyon mongs pa spong na so sor ma brtags pa'i 'gog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spong na so sor ma brtags pa'i 'gog par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the defilements are abandoned, they become a non-analytical cessation.

original: ma yin te chud mi za ba zhes bya ba ni gnyen pos ma bcos na 'bras bu bskyed pa la bya ste /
analyzed: ma yin te chud mi za ba zhes bya ba ni gnyen pos ma bcos na 'bras bu bskyed pa la bya ste /
translated: No, because nonexpiration is said to be the generation of a result if it is not modified by an antidote.

original: nyon mongs pa zad na de ni 'dod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa zad na de ni 'dod pa kho na ste /
translated: If afflictions are exhausted, then that is just the desire realm.

original: thog ma med pa'i las dag ji ltar zad par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i las dag ji ltar zad par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How are beginningless karmas exhausted?

original: gnyen pos bsgom zhing rgyu 'gog pas na mi bya ba mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: gnyen pos bsgom zhing rgyu 'gog pas na mi bya ba mi byed pa'o //
translated: They are not done by not doing, since they are cultivated by an antidote and their cause is stopped.

original: nges don bstan pa'i sgo nas bsdu ba ni /
analyzed: nges don bstan pa'i sgo nas bsdu ba ni /
translated: The summary from the perspective of teaching the definitive meaning is

original: yang de nyid las 'byung ba zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yang de nyid las 'byung ba zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: as it occurs in that text:üîΩOne does not transgress the Dharma out of desire,

original: 'dun dang zhe sdang 'jigs pa dang // rmongs pas gang zhig chos mi 'da' //
analyzed: 'dun dang zhe sdang 'jigs pa dang // rmongs pas gang zhig chos mi 'da' //
translated: aversion, fear, or confusion.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis ni bya ba kha na ma tho ba mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis ni bya ba kha na ma tho ba mi byed pa ste /
translated: In this way, one does not do what should not be done.

original: gzhan du na /
analyzed: gzhan du na /
translated: Otherwise,

original: nga yi bstan la ma gus gang //
analyzed: nga yi bstan la ma gus gang //
translated: one who has no respect for my teaching

original: de yis nga mthong ci zhig bya //
analyzed: de yis nga mthong ci zhig bya //
translated: what will he see in me?

original: zhe'o // dad pa'i yul bstan pa'i phyir dad pa ni @229a * //
analyzed: zhe'o // dad pa'i yul bstan pa'i phyir dad pa ni @229a * //
translated: Faith is taught as the object of faith.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshams sbyor te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshams sbyor te /
translated: The summary is connected byüîΩfaith in the Buddha,

original: dge ba'i chos ni dkar po'i chos mtha' dag bskyed pa'i rgyu byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos ni dkar po'i chos mtha' dag bskyed pa'i rgyu byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: The virtuous phenomena are the cause for generating all virtuous phenomena, which is the thought of awakening.

original: sngon du 'gro ba ni /
analyzed: sngon du 'gro ba ni /
translated: The preliminaries are:

original: rgyal dang rgyal ba'i chos la dad gyur cing //
analyzed: rgyal dang rgyal ba'i chos la dad gyur cing //
translated: Having faith in the Victorious One and the Dharma,

original: byang chub bla na med la dad gyur pa //
analyzed: byang chub bla na med la dad gyur pa //
translated: Having faith in unsurpassed awakening,

original: sangs rgyas sras kyi spyod la dad byed na //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sras kyi spyod la dad byed na //
translated: And having faith in the conduct of the Buddha's heirs,

original: skyes bu dam pa rnams kyi sems skye'o //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa rnams kyi sems skye'o //
translated: The mind of the excellent beings arises.

original: zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said.

original: de la dad pa rnam pa gsum gyis yul gang la dad par gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la dad pa rnam pa gsum gyis yul gang la dad par gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, What are the three types of faith that are the objects of faith?

original: 'di lta de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di lta de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said, The Thus-Gone One, and so forth.

original: dad pa'i yul ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dad pa'i yul ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The objects of faith are threefold:

original: sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun dang / sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang / lam dang / las dang / 'bras bu rnams so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun dang / sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang / lam dang / las dang / 'bras bu rnams so //
translated: The Buddha, Dharma, and Sa·πÖgha; suffering, origination, cessation, and the path; and karma and its results.

original: yul de gsum mtshon pa'i don du de bzhin gshegs pa smos te /
analyzed: yul de gsum mtshon pa'i don du de bzhin gshegs pa smos te /
translated: The Thus-Gone One is mentioned for the purpose of illustrating those three objects.

original: gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because he is the principal one.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de'i yon tan gang rnams she na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de'i yon tan gang rnams she na /
translated: What are the qualities of that Tathagata?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: phung po yongs su dag pa'i yon tan dang / brjod pa yongs su dag pa dang / mdzad pa yongs su dag pa dang / mkhyen pa yongs su dag pa dang / gzigs pa yongs su dag pa dang / mngon par 'phags pa'i yon tan rnams so //
analyzed: phung po yongs su dag pa'i yon tan dang / brjod pa yongs su dag pa dang / mdzad pa yongs su dag pa dang / mkhyen pa yongs su dag pa dang / gzigs pa yongs su dag pa dang / mngon par 'phags pa'i yon tan rnams so //
translated: The quality of the purity of the aggregates, the purity of expression, the purity of action, the purity of knowledge, the purity of vision, and the qualities of eminence.

original: de la phung po yongs su dag pa ni /
analyzed: de la phung po yongs su dag pa ni /
translated: The purity of the aggregates is

original: tshul khrims kyi phung po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes gzigs pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi phung po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes gzigs pa'i phung po'o //
translated: the aggregate of morality, the aggregate of meditative concentration, the aggregate of wisdom, the aggregate of liberation, and the aggregate of the vision and knowledge of liberation.

original: brjod pa yongs su dag pa ni ji lta ba las brtsams nas chos rnams kyi rang bzhin brjod pa dang / ji snyed yod pa las brtsams nas chos kyi rnam grangs brjod pa'o //
analyzed: brjod pa yongs su dag pa ni ji lta ba las brtsams nas chos rnams kyi rang bzhin brjod pa dang / ji snyed yod pa las brtsams nas chos kyi rnam grangs brjod pa'o //
translated: The purity of expression is the expression of the nature of things beginning with the way things are and the expression of the categories of things beginning with the extent of things.

original: mdzad pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mdzad pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Action is twofold:

original: mi rtog pa dang / dus thams cad pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: mi rtog pa dang / dus thams cad pa'i phrin las so //
translated: 10. the knowledge of the non-conceptual, and 11. the activity which is at all times.

original: mkhyen pa ni rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: mkhyen pa ni rnam pa drug ste /
translated: The knowledge is sixfold:

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa dang / lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / 'chi 'pho dang ; skye ba shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / zag pa zad pa mngon par mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa dang / lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / 'chi 'pho dang ; skye ba shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / zag pa zad pa mngon par mkhyen pa'o //
translated: 1. the knowledge of the object of supernormal power, 2. the superknowledge of the divine ear, 3. the knowledge of the mind of another, 4. the knowledge of death and rebirth, 5. the knowledge of recollecting former abodes, and 6. the knowledge of the extinction of the impure influences.

original: gzigs pa ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: gzigs pa ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The vision is fivefold:

original: sha'i spyan dang / lha'i spyan dang / shes rab kyi spyan dang / chos kyi spyan dang / sangs rgyas kyi spyan no //
analyzed: sha'i spyan dang / lha'i spyan dang / shes rab kyi spyan dang / chos kyi spyan dang / sangs rgyas kyi spyan no //
translated: 1. the fleshly eye, 2. the divine eye, 3. the eye of wisdom, 4. the eye of Dharma, and 5. the eye of the Buddha.

original: mngon par 'phags pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: mngon par 'phags pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The transcendence is threefold:

original: sku dang / @229b gsung dang thugs kyis mngon par 'phags pa ste /
analyzed: sku dang / @229b gsung dang thugs kyis mngon par 'phags pa ste /
translated: the transcendence of body, speech, and mind.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan ni mdor bsdu na 'di dag tu zad de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan ni mdor bsdu na 'di dag tu zad de /
translated: In brief, the qualities of the Tathagata are just these.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang dang gzhan gyi don mtha' dag bsdus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi don mtha' dag bsdus pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they include all the aims of self and others.

original: lung las yon tan ji snyed brjod pa thams cad kyang 'di gnyis kho nar zad do //üîΩde la zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga las gtso bo yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lung las yon tan ji snyed brjod pa thams cad kyang 'di gnyis kho nar zad do // de la zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga las gtso bo yin pa'i phyir /
translated: All the qualities mentioned in the scriptures are exhausted in just these two.üîΩAmong the five uncontaminated aggregates, the aggregate of the wisdom of liberation is the most important.

original: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po ni sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes mthong ba zhes smos pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po ni sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes mthong ba zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the aggregate of seeing the wisdom of liberation is called unobstructed wisdom-seeing.

original: ji lta ba las brtsams nas chos kyi rang bzhin brjod pa ni des bstan pa ni mthong bar dka' ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji lta ba las brtsams nas chos kyi rang bzhin brjod pa ni des bstan pa ni mthong bar dka' ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The explanation of the nature of phenomena beginning with the way things are is stated from It is taught that it is difficult to see... and so on.

original: tshu rol mthong ba'i yul ma yin pas shes par dka' ba'o //
analyzed: tshu rol mthong ba'i yul ma yin pas shes par dka' ba'o //
translated: It is difficult to know because it is not the object of those who see only this side.

original: tshad ma'i yul ma yin pas shes par dka' ba'o //
analyzed: tshad ma'i yul ma yin pas shes par dka' ba'o //
translated: It is difficult to know because it is not the object of valid cognition.

original: 'phags pa'i spyod yul du gyur pas zab pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i spyod yul du gyur pas zab pa'o //
translated: It is profound because it is the domain of the noble ones.

original: spros pa dang bral bas rgyu ba chad pa'o //
analyzed: spros pa dang bral bas rgyu ba chad pa'o //
translated: It is the cessation of movement because it is free from conceptual elaborations.

original: gzhi ma grub pas mig kyang med ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhi ma grub pas mig kyang med ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Since it is not an established basis, it is said that the eye does not exist and so on.

original: chos can med pa la chos mi 'thad pas mi 'gag pa yang med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: chos can med pa la chos mi 'thad pas mi 'gag pa yang med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: Since a phenomenon is not tenable without a basis, he says, ‚Äúcessation does not exist.‚Äù

original: de lta mod kyi 'on kyang kun rdzob tu ji snyed yod pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi 'on kyang kun rdzob tu ji snyed yod pa las brtsams te /
translated: However, in terms of however much exists conventionally,

original: chos rnams kyi rnam grangs brjod pa ni yan lag drug cu dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rnam grangs brjod pa ni yan lag drug cu dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúthe enumeration of phenomena is endowed with sixty aspects,‚Äù and so on.

original: gsung yan lag drug cu ni /
analyzed: gsung yan lag drug cu ni /
translated: The sixty aspects of speech

original: gsang ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i mdo las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gsang ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i mdo las shes par bya'o //
translated: should be understood from the Tantra of the Inconceivable Secrets.

original: de las ci byed ce na /
analyzed: de las ci byed ce na /
translated: What does it do?

original: 'khrul pa mtha' dag gi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa mtha' dag gi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the antidote to all errors.

original: ngag gi las yongs su dag pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ngag gi las yongs su dag pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: He says, ‚Äúpure verbal activity,‚Äù and so on.

original: de ltar rgyas par bshad pa bsdu ba'i phyir mi mkhyen pa'am zhes bya ba gsungs te /üîΩji lta ba'i don mkhyen pas mi mkhyen pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rgyas par bshad pa bsdu ba'i phyir mi mkhyen pa'am zhes bya ba gsungs te / ji lta ba'i don mkhyen pas mi mkhyen pa med pa'o //
translated: In order to summarize the extensive explanation, he says, ‚Äúnot knowing,‚Äù and so on.üîΩSince he knows the meaning of the way things are, he does not not know.

original: ji snyed yod pa mkhyen pas ma gzigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: ji snyed yod pa mkhyen pas ma gzigs pa med pa'o //
translated: Since he knows however much exists, he does not not see.

original: de gnyis ka'i ngo bos mngon sum du ma mdzad pa med pa dang / mngon par sangs rgyas pa med pa'o //üîΩmdzad pa yongs su dag pa ni /
analyzed: de gnyis ka'i ngo bos mngon sum du ma mdzad pa med pa dang / mngon par sangs rgyas pa med pa'o // mdzad pa yongs su dag pa ni /
translated: There is nothing that is not directly perceived by the essence of both of those, and there is nothing that is not fully enlightened.

original: spyan yongs su dag pa dang ldan pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: spyan yongs su dag pa dang ldan pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: The purity of deeds is stated in the line ‚Äúendowed with the purity of eyes.

original: nyin mtshan lan drug tu gzigs pas na kun nas spyan dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: nyin mtshan lan drug tu gzigs pas na kun nas spyan dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with all-seeing eyes because he sees with the six superknowledges.

original: yang na gdul bya dus gsum pa rnams yal bar mi 'dor bar dus thams cad pa'i phrin las dang mi rtog pa'i phrin las kyis gzigs pas na kun nas spyan dang ldan pa'o //üîΩ@230a * // drug mngon par mkhyen pa'i gtso bo yin pa'i phyir zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yang na gdul bya dus gsum pa rnams yal bar mi 'dor bar dus thams cad pa'i phrin las dang mi rtog pa'i phrin las kyis gzigs pas na kun nas spyan dang ldan pa'o // @230a * // drug mngon par mkhyen pa'i gtso bo yin pa'i phyir zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa bstan pa ni /
translated: Or, he is endowed with all-seeing eyes because he sees with the activity of all times and the activity of nonconceptuality, without neglecting those to be tamed in the three times.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩgzigs pa yongs su dag pa spyan lnga las dang po yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // gzigs pa yongs su dag pa spyan lnga las dang po yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The superknowledge of the extinction of defilements is taught in the line ‚Äúfree from desire.üîΩThe purity of seeing is stated in the line ‚Äúendowed with the five eyes.

original: sha'i spyan smos te /
analyzed: sha'i spyan smos te /
translated: The first of those is the flesh eye,

original: mthar thug pa med pas dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: mthar thug pa med pas dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: and it is immeasurable because it is limitless.

original: mngon par 'phags pa'i yon tan las sku mngon par 'phags pa ni /
analyzed: mngon par 'phags pa'i yon tan las sku mngon par 'phags pa ni /
translated: The excellence of the body of the Buddha is shown by the excellence of his qualities.

original: spyi gtsug bltar mi snang ba'o //
analyzed: spyi gtsug bltar mi snang ba'o //
translated: The excellence of his head is shown by the fact that his ushnisha is invisible.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa ston pas zab pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa ston pas zab pa'o //
translated: The excellence of his speech is shown by the fact that he teaches the conventional truth in a way that is profound.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa ston pas don dam pa ston pa ste /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa ston pas don dam pa ston pa ste /
translated: The excellence of his mind is shown by the fact that he teaches the ultimate truth.

original: 'di gnyis ni gsung mngon par 'phags pa'i yon tan no //üîΩthugs mngon par 'phags pa ni /
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni gsung mngon par 'phags pa'i yon tan no // thugs mngon par 'phags pa ni /
translated: These two are the excellence of his speech.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi bla na med par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi bla na med par gyur pa ste /
translated: The excellence of his mind is shown by the fact that he is the unsurpassed teacher of all the teachings of the Buddha.

original: de la mtshan bzang po sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu mtshon pa'i phyir sku mngon par 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: de la mtshan bzang po sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu mtshon pa'i phyir sku mngon par 'phags pa'o //
translated: Among them, the excellence of his body is shown by the fact that he has the thirty-two marks of a great person and the eighty minor marks.

original: gsung yan lag lnga dang ldan pa bstan pa'i phyir gsung 'phags pa bstan te /
analyzed: gsung yan lag lnga dang ldan pa bstan pa'i phyir gsung 'phags pa bstan te /
translated: The excellence of his speech is shown by the fact that he teaches with the five branches of speech.

original: gsung yan lag lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsung yan lag lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five branches of speech?

original: yongs su shes shing rnam par shes par 'gyur ba dang / mnyan na bde zhing mi mthun pa med pa dang / zab cing dbyangs rjes su 'byung ba dang / gtang mi bra zhing rnar snyan pa dang / ma 'khrugs shing gsal ba'o ;
analyzed: yongs su shes shing rnam par shes par 'gyur ba dang / mnyan na bde zhing mi mthun pa med pa dang / zab cing dbyangs rjes su 'byung ba dang / gtang mi bra zhing rnar snyan pa dang / ma 'khrugs shing gsal ba'o ;
translated: and it is undisturbed and clear.

original: / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / zad par gyi skye mched bcu dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad dang /
analyzed: / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / zad par gyi skye mched bcu dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad dang /
translated: It is the thirty-seven factors of awakening, the four immeasurables, the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions, the ten universal bases, the eight bases of subjugation,

original: nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon nas mkhyen pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / rnam pa thams cad du yongs su dag pa bzhi dang / dbang bcu dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon nas mkhyen pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / rnam pa thams cad du yongs su dag pa bzhi dang / dbang bcu dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang /
translated: the ten totalities, the four states of formlessness, the six clairvoyances, the four correct and discerning knowledges, the four purities in all aspects, the ten powers, the ten powers, the four forms of fearlessness,üîΩthe four forms of precise knowledge, the four aspects of correct knowledge, the eighteen distinct qualities of the Buddha, and the great compassion.

original: srung ba med pa gsum dang / dgongs pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum dang / bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid dang / bag chags yang dag par bcom pa dang / thugs rje chen po dang / ma 'dres pa'i chos bco brgyad dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad de thugs mngon par 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: srung ba med pa gsum dang / dgongs pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum dang / bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid dang / bag chags yang dag par bcom pa dang / thugs rje chen po dang / ma 'dres pa'i chos bco brgyad dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad de thugs mngon par 'phags pa'o //
translated: The three unhindered knowledges, the three foundations of mindfulness, the nature of nonforgetfulness, the destruction of the propensities, great compassion, and the eighteen special qualities of the Buddha are all the qualities of the Buddha, which are superior cognitions.

original: yon tan rnam pa gsum po 'di dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yon tan rnam pa gsum po 'di dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las rig par bya'o //
translated: These three kinds of qualities should be understood from the Perfection of Wisdom.

original: de dag gi ngo bo @230b nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gi ngo bo @230b nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is their nature?

original: de la dad pa'i stobs gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la dad pa'i stobs gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here, what is the power of faith? and so on is declared.

original: dad pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dad pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Faith is of three kinds:

original: yid ches pa dang / dang ba dang / 'dod pa'i dad pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: yid ches pa dang / dang ba dang / 'dod pa'i dad pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: the nature of faith is confidence, clarity, and desire.

original: de la mi brdzi bas ni stobs zhes bya ste chen po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la mi brdzi bas ni stobs zhes bya ste chen po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Among them, it is called power because it is unbreakable, meaning great.

original: de la yid ches pa'i ngo bo nyid ni mngon par dad pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la yid ches pa'i ngo bo nyid ni mngon par dad pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The nature of confidence in that is the faith of conviction, etc.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ni des gsungs pa'i las dang 'bras bu phyin ci ma log pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ni des gsungs pa'i las dang 'bras bu phyin ci ma log pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The Buddha's teachings are the unerring characteristics of actions and their results as taught by him.

original: las dang las kyi rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: las dang las kyi rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called actions and the maturation of actions.

original: de la lus la sogs pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa ni las zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la lus la sogs pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa ni las zhes bya ste /
translated: Among them, the manifest activity of the body, etc. is called action.

original: dge ba la sogs pa rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: It is of three kinds, virtuous, etc.

original: rnyog pa ni bdag tu lta ba yin la /
analyzed: rnyog pa ni bdag tu lta ba yin la /
translated: Mud is the view of self.

original: mos par spyod pa'i sa la chos thams cad bdag med par yid ches pa ni rtog pa med pa'i sems so //
analyzed: mos par spyod pa'i sa la chos thams cad bdag med par yid ches pa ni rtog pa med pa'i sems so //
translated: The mind without conceptualization is the confidence in the selflessness of all things on the stage of action in faith.

original: chos thams cad ces bya ba ni phyi dang nang gi dngos po thams cad de /
analyzed: chos thams cad ces bya ba ni phyi dang nang gi dngos po thams cad de /
translated: All things are all internal and external things.

original: gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: Because they are free from unity and multiplicity,

original: ngo bo nyid med pas stong pa nyid dang / rang dang gzhan gnyi ga dang rgyu med pa las mi skye bas rgyu'i mtshan ma med pa dang / yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi ga las mi skye bas 'bras bu smon pa med pa dang /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pas stong pa nyid dang / rang dang gzhan gnyi ga dang rgyu med pa las mi skye bas rgyu'i mtshan ma med pa dang / yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi ga las mi skye bas 'bras bu smon pa med pa dang /
translated: Since they are not produced from existence, nonexistence, or both, the result is wishless.

original: de'i phyir 'du byed thams cad dang bral nas mngon par 'du mi byed pa ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyis dben pa ste ma mthong ba'i lam gyi mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs su dad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'du byed thams cad dang bral nas mngon par 'du mi byed pa ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyis dben pa ste ma mthong ba'i lam gyi mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs su dad pa'o //
translated: Therefore, free from all formative predispositions, the state of non-formation is the absence of all discursive thought. This is faith in the path of seeing, the state of meditative equipoise.

original: de'i rjes la thob pa nas sa lnga pa'i bar du thabs shes rab zung du 'brel pa'i ngo bo nyid du dad pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la thob pa nas sa lnga pa'i bar du thabs shes rab zung du 'brel pa'i ngo bo nyid du dad pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Subsequently, from the second to the fifth spiritual levels, faith is the nature of the union of means and wisdom and consists of generosity and so forth.

original: sa drug pa nas bcu pa'i bar du shes rab rnam pa bzhi ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba shes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sa drug pa nas bcu pa'i bar du shes rab rnam pa bzhi ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba shes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: From the sixth to the tenth spiritual levels, wisdom is fourfold, consisting of the knowledge of the dependent origination of things and so forth.

original: de ltar na pha rol tu phyin pa bcu ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam la yid ches pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar na pha rol tu phyin pa bcu ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam la yid ches pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Thus, the ten perfections are the very essence of confidence in the paths of seeing and cultivation.

original: la la dag ni mtho ris kyi rgyu ni las dang las kyi rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: la la dag ni mtho ris kyi rgyu ni las dang las kyi rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: Some say: The cause of high status is karma and the maturation of karma.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spong ba ni rnyog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spong ba ni rnyog pa med pa'o //
translated: The elimination of the afflictive obstructions is non-turbidity.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa spong bas na stong pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa spong bas na stong pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: The elimination of the obstructions to omniscience is emptiness and so on.

original: theg pa mchog 'dod pas na pha rol tu phyin pa drug ste /
analyzed: theg pa mchog 'dod pas na pha rol tu phyin pa drug ste /
translated: The desire for the supreme vehicle is the six perfections.

original: mdor na mtho ris dang byang grol gyi sa la yid ches pas yin no zer ro //
analyzed: mdor na mtho ris dang byang grol gyi sa la yid ches pas yin no zer ro //
translated: In brief, it is confidence in the stages of high status and definite goodness.

original: la la dag ni dngos su byung ba dang zhar la byung ba'i don te /üîΩlas dang las kyi rnam par smin pa la dad @231a * //
analyzed: la la dag ni dngos su byung ba dang zhar la byung ba'i don te / las dang las kyi rnam par smin pa la dad @231a * //
translated: Some say: The meaning of the perfections is direct and indirect.

original: pa ni dngos su yid ches pa'i dad pa ni yin la /
analyzed: pa ni dngos su yid ches pa'i dad pa ni yin la /
translated: Faith in karma and the maturation of karma is direct confidence.

original: rnyog pa med pa'i sems la sogs pa ni zhar las byung ba ste /
analyzed: rnyog pa med pa'i sems la sogs pa ni zhar las byung ba ste /
translated: Non-turbid minds and so on are indirect.

original: de la rnyog pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnyog pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Turbidity is the apprehension of objects and subjects.

original: de dang bral ba'i rang rig pa'i sems 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid ni rnyog pa med pa'i sems so //
analyzed: de dang bral ba'i rang rig pa'i sems 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid ni rnyog pa med pa'i sems so //
translated: The mind that is self-aware and free from that is the essence of the clear light mind, which is the unclouded mind.

original: kun tu brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin dag ni mtshan nyid dang / skye ba dang / don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid med pas stong pa nyid la sogs pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: kun tu brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin dag ni mtshan nyid dang / skye ba dang / don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid med pas stong pa nyid la sogs pa nyid yin la /
translated: The imagined nature, the dependent nature, and the perfected nature are emptiness, etc., because they lack the nature of characteristics, arising, and the ultimate.

original: 'od gsal ba'i sems las ma gtogs pa'i sems gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid tshol bar mi byed pa dang / chos nyid sems las gzhan pa'i sems gzhan no //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba'i sems las ma gtogs pa'i sems gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid tshol bar mi byed pa dang / chos nyid sems las gzhan pa'i sems gzhan no //
translated: One does not seek the essence of a mind that is different from the clear light mind, and the nature of phenomena is not a different mind from the mind.

original: yod pa ma yin rang bzhin brjod do zhes 'byung bas mngon par 'du mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin rang bzhin brjod do zhes 'byung bas mngon par 'du mi byed pa'o //
translated: Since it is said that ‚Äúone does not describe the nature of what does not exist,‚Äù it is non-formation.

original: de ltar lta ba rnam par dag pas spyod pa phun sum tshogs pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa drug dang bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi bstan to zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: de ltar lta ba rnam par dag pas spyod pa phun sum tshogs pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa drug dang bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi bstan to zhes 'dod do //
translated: Thus, it is asserted that the perfect practice of the pure view is the six perfections and the four means of gathering disciples.

original: dang po'i ngo bo nyid ni dang ba'i mtshan nyid ni dad pa ste zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dang po'i ngo bo nyid ni dang ba'i mtshan nyid ni dad pa ste zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Faith is the essence of clarity.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rtog pa dang bar byed pas na nor bu chu dang ltar dang bar byed pa'o /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rtog pa dang bar byed pas na nor bu chu dang ltar dang bar byed pa'o /
translated: It is clarity, like a crystal, because it makes the mind clear of the concepts of attachment, etc.

original: rtog pa med pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: rtog pa med pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is non-conceptuality?

original: gang chags pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang chags pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the absence of attachment.

original: yul gang zhe na /
analyzed: yul gang zhe na /
translated: What is its object?

original: theg pa chen po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po zhes bya ste /
translated: It is the Great Vehicle.

original: rnam pa bzhi ni theg pa chen po rgyud dang bar byed pa'i gtso bo yin pas theg pa chen po smos so //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi ni theg pa chen po rgyud dang bar byed pa'i gtso bo yin pas theg pa chen po smos so //
translated: The four kinds are mentioned because they are the principal causes of clarity of the Great Vehicle.

original: gzhan dag ni dang ba'i dad pa ni mos pa gtso bo yin pas mos par spyod pa'i sa la 'dod de /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni dang ba'i dad pa ni mos pa gtso bo yin pas mos par spyod pa'i sa la 'dod de /
translated: Others believe that faith as clarity is desire, and so is accepted as being on the level of action through aspiration, because aspiration is the principal element.

original: re zhig tshogs kyis la sgra'i rjes su 'gro bas byang chub sems dpa' rtag tu du dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas shin tu skom nas du zhing cho nges 'debs te /
analyzed: re zhig tshogs kyis la sgra'i rjes su 'gro bas byang chub sems dpa' rtag tu du dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas shin tu skom nas du zhing cho nges 'debs te /
translated: The bodhisattva who is on the level of action through faith is one who is always in the presence of spiritual friends, who is thirsty for the perfection of wisdom, and who weeps and laments, because he is still following the letter.

original: nyin mtshan bdun 'das pa lta bu dang / rgyal po la gdams pa las /
analyzed: nyin mtshan bdun 'das pa lta bu dang / rgyal po la gdams pa las /
translated: It is like the statement in the Sutra of Advice to a King:üîΩ‚ÄúHaving seen the image of the Perfectly Awakened One, for seven days one should look without closing one‚Äôs eyes and one should not let the flow of tears cease.‚Äù

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gzugs brnyan mthong bas zhag bdun du mig mi 'dzums par lta zhing mchi ma'i rgyun mi 'chad par byung zhing zhes bya ba dang / 'phags pa nor bzangs kyis dge ba'i bshes gnyen mthong ma thag tu mig mchi mas gang bar dus te zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gzugs brnyan mthong bas zhag bdun du mig mi 'dzums par lta zhing mchi ma'i rgyun mi 'chad par byung zhing zhes bya ba dang / 'phags pa nor bzangs kyis dge ba'i bshes gnyen mthong ma thag tu mig mchi mas gang bar dus te zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: And it is like the statement in the Noble Cloud of Jewels: ‚ÄúAs soon as the good friend was seen by the noble Sudhana, his eyes were filled with tears.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir tshogs kyi sa la ni theg pa la mos pa mi bzlogs pas na @231b dad pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshogs kyi sa la ni theg pa la mos pa mi bzlogs pas na @231b dad pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, on the stage of accumulation, since one‚Äôs interest in the vehicle is irreversible, it is called the power of faith.

original: drod dang rtse mo'i gnas skabs na dbang byed pa'i phyir dbang po'o //
analyzed: drod dang rtse mo'i gnas skabs na dbang byed pa'i phyir dbang po'o //
translated: On the stages of heat and peak, since it is dominant, it is called the faculty.

original: bzod pa dang chos kyi mchog tu mi brdzi ba'i phyir stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bzod pa dang chos kyi mchog tu mi brdzi ba'i phyir stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: On the stages of patience and the supreme mundane state, since it is irreversible, it is called the power.

original: 'dir gtso bo yin pas dad pa 'ba' zhig smos te brtson 'grus la sogs pa yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gtso bo yin pas dad pa 'ba' zhig smos te brtson 'grus la sogs pa yang rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, only faith is mentioned because it is the principal one, but effort and so on should also be understood.

original: de la lus la sogs pa la ma zhen pas chags pa med pa khong du chud pa ste /
analyzed: de la lus la sogs pa la ma zhen pas chags pa med pa khong du chud pa ste /
translated: The understanding of nonattachment is the nonattachment to the body, etc.

original: dper na byang chub sems dpa' rtag tu du brla'i sha btogs shing rus pa gcog pa dang / lag pa phug ste khrag gzag go zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na byang chub sems dpa' rtag tu du brla'i sha btogs shing rus pa gcog pa dang / lag pa phug ste khrag gzag go zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the bodhisattva Sadaprarudita cut the flesh from his own body, broke his bones, and pierced his own arm, letting his blood flow.

original: ma zhen pa ni rang bzhin med par khong du chud pas dngos por lta bas mi brdzi ba'i phyir stobs zhes bya'o zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: ma zhen pa ni rang bzhin med par khong du chud pas dngos por lta bas mi brdzi ba'i phyir stobs zhes bya'o zhes 'chad do //
translated: Nonattachment is called strength because it is not overwhelmed by the view of real entities, since it is the understanding of the absence of intrinsic reality.

original: de ltar dang ba'i ngo bo nyid bshad nas 'dod pa'i dad pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa ni gzhan yang zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar dang ba'i ngo bo nyid bshad nas 'dod pa'i dad pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa ni gzhan yang zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Thus, having explained the nature of faith, he teaches the nature of faith in the desire realm, saying, moreover.

original: bden pa bzhi rtogs par 'dod pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa ni gzhan gyi sgra la dad pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi rtogs par 'dod pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa ni gzhan gyi sgra la dad pa'o //
translated: The desire to understand the four noble truths is the reliance on a spiritual friend, which is faith in the words of another.

original: de la dad pa ni 'dod pa'i dad pa'o //
analyzed: de la dad pa ni 'dod pa'i dad pa'o //
translated: Faith in that is faith in the desire realm.

original: ji ltar zhe na 'og nas gzhan gyi sgra thos nas mngon par dad pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na 'og nas gzhan gyi sgra thos nas mngon par dad pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: How so? Because it will be said below, ‚Äúhaving heard the words of another, one has faith.‚Äù

original: 'dod pa ni 'dun pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa ni 'dun pa ste /
translated: Desire is aspiration.

original: gzhan gyi sgra dang tshul bzhin yid la byed pa las don rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sgra dang tshul bzhin yid la byed pa las don rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one acquires the meaning from the words of another and from proper mental attention.

original: de la sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam dag ni shes par bya ba dang / spong bar bya ba dang / mngon du bya ba dang / rgyud la bskyed par 'dod pa'i phyir dang po gzhan gyi sgra la dad pa ste /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam dag ni shes par bya ba dang / spong bar bya ba dang / mngon du bya ba dang / rgyud la bskyed par 'dod pa'i phyir dang po gzhan gyi sgra la dad pa ste /
translated: In this regard, one has faith in the words of another with regard to the truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and the path, because one wishes to know, abandon, realize, and cultivate them.

original: chos thos par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: chos thos par 'dod pa'o //
translated: One wishes to hear the Dharma.

original: chos gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos gang zhe na /
translated: What is the Dharma?

original: sbyor ba rim can du bslab par bya bas bden pa bzhin rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba rim can du bslab par bya bas bden pa bzhin rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the four noble truths, because they are to be realized in a sequential order of practice.

original: sbyor ba rim can zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa la bya ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba rim can zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa la bya ste /
translated: The sequential order of practice refers to morality, hearing, reflection, and meditation.

original: 'di na dang por thos la brten nas yid la byed pa 'byung //
analyzed: 'di na dang por thos la brten nas yid la byed pa 'byung //
translated: Here, first, mental attention arises in dependence upon hearing.

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed las yang dag don yul ye shes 'byung //
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed las yang dag don yul ye shes 'byung //
translated: From proper mental attention, there arises intuition whose object is the true meaning.

original: de las chos thob de yod de las blo gros rab tu skye //
analyzed: de las chos thob de yod de las blo gros rab tu skye //
translated: From that, one attains the Dharma, and from that, the highest wisdom arises.

original: gang tshe de ni so so yang rig med na ji ltar nges //üîΩzhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang tshe de ni so so yang rig med na ji ltar nges // zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: If it is not known by itself, how can it be ascertained?

original: de lta bas na dang po smon pa dang ldan pa'i sems rgyud la bskyed pas na byang chub kyi sems yang dag par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na dang po smon pa dang ldan pa'i sems rgyud la bskyed pas na byang chub kyi sems yang dag par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the generation of the thought of enlightenment is the taking up of the thought of enlightenment, by the generation of the thought endowed with aspiration in the stream of consciousness.

original: 'jug pa'i sdom pa len pas na spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sdom pa len pas na spyod pa'o //
translated: The practice is the taking up of the vow of the engaged thought of enlightenment.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i sems rnam pa bcu @232a * //üîΩni byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i sems rnam pa bcu @232a * // ni byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: The thought of enlightenment is the ten kinds of consciousness included in the path of insight.

original: lam de la 'jug pa'i rgyud pa'i 'byor ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: lam de la 'jug pa'i rgyud pa'i 'byor ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The three kinds of mastery in the stream of consciousness that enters that path are the three kinds of thought of enlightenment.

original: de gsum mtshon pa'i phyir 'gyur ba med pa ni bsam pa'o //
analyzed: de gsum mtshon pa'i phyir 'gyur ba med pa ni bsam pa'o //
translated: The unchangeable thought is the intention, because it is the sign of those three.

original: dngos kyi sbyor ba 'bras bu gsum dang ldan pa ni sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: dngos kyi sbyor ba 'bras bu gsum dang ldan pa ni sbyor ba'o //
translated: The thought of application is the application, which is the actual application endowed with the three fruits.

original: rang gi don bsgrub pa'i thabs ni pha rol tu phyin pa'o ;
analyzed: rang gi don bsgrub pa'i thabs ni pha rol tu phyin pa'o ;
translated: The thought of perfection is the perfection, which is the means of accomplishing one‚Äôs own goal.

original: / gzhan gyi don bsgrub pa'i thabs ni bsdu ba'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: / gzhan gyi don bsgrub pa'i thabs ni bsdu ba'i dngos po'o //
translated: The thought of collection is the collection, which is the means of accomplishing the goals of others.

original: gnyi ga'i bsgrub pa'i rgyu ni thabs la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i bsgrub pa'i rgyu ni thabs la mkhas pa ste /
translated: The thought of skill in means is the skill in means, which is the cause of accomplishing both.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen no //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen no //
translated: The thought of good friend is the spiritual teacher.

original: 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid ni sngar bshad pa'i chos rnams te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid ni sngar bshad pa'i chos rnams te /
translated: The essence of the result is the above-mentioned qualities,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos so //
translated: the qualities of a Buddha.

original: lam rnam pa bzhi ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos de dag ni sbyor ba rim bzhin du bslab pa rnams so //
analyzed: lam rnam pa bzhi ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos de dag ni sbyor ba rim bzhin du bslab pa rnams so //
translated: The four aspects of the path are the trainings in the above-mentioned qualities of the Bodhisattva.

original: la la na re mos pa gtso bor gyur pa'i dang po'i ngo bo nyid kyi bzod pa dang chos kyi mchog tu dad pa'i stobs gtso bor bshad pa de la ci'i phyir stobs zhes bya /
analyzed: la la na re mos pa gtso bor gyur pa'i dang po'i ngo bo nyid kyi bzod pa dang chos kyi mchog tu dad pa'i stobs gtso bor bshad pa de la ci'i phyir stobs zhes bya /
translated: Some say that the essence of the first stage is faith, which is the main thing in the stage of devoted interest, and the power of faith, which is the main thing in the stage of the highest mundane experience. Why are they called powers?

original: gang gis brdzi bar mi nus she na /
analyzed: gang gis brdzi bar mi nus she na /
translated: By what are they not overcome?

original: byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa 'og nas 'chad pa rnams dang ldan pas stobs zhes bya la /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa 'og nas 'chad pa rnams dang ldan pas stobs zhes bya la /
translated: They are called powers because they are endowed with the enlightenment mind and so forth, which will be explained below.

original: de dag gis mi mthun pa zil gyis non pas na mi brdzi ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gis mi mthun pa zil gyis non pas na mi brdzi ba'o //
translated: They are not overcome because they overpower their opposites.

original: byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa rnams dang ldan pa ni yongs su 'dzin pa la rag lus pas gzhan gyi sgra'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa rnams dang ldan pa ni yongs su 'dzin pa la rag lus pas gzhan gyi sgra'o //
translated: The powers are dependent on the commitments, and the powers are the voice of others.

original: gzhan las zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan las zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la sogs pa ste /
translated: From others refers to the Perfectly Awakened Ones, etc.

original: de tshe chos kyi rgyun la ni //üîΩsangs rgyas rnams la zhi gnas dang // ye shes yangs pa thob bya'i phyir //
analyzed: de tshe chos kyi rgyun la ni // sangs rgyas rnams la zhi gnas dang // ye shes yangs pa thob bya'i phyir //
translated: At that time, in the stream of Dharma,üîΩthe Buddhas give extensive instructions

original: gdams ngag rgya chen rnyed par 'gyur //
analyzed: gdams ngag rgya chen rnyed par 'gyur //
translated: to the Bodhisattvas for the sake of attaining extensive serenity and wisdom.

original: zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes 'dod do //
translated: This is what they believe.

original: da ni phan yon bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni phan yon bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now the benefits will be explained.

original: sh'a ri'i bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa skabs 'byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa skabs 'byed pa yin no //
translated: The passage beginning ‚ÄúShariputra‚Äù introduces the topic.

original: de la mdo gcig gis bshad pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod las kyang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la mdo gcig gis bshad pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod las kyang zhes bya'o //
translated: The explanation by one sutra is ‚Äúalso in the Bodhisattva Canon.‚Äù

original: mdo du ma'i sgo nas bshad pa ni /
analyzed: mdo du ma'i sgo nas bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation by many sutras is

original: zla ba snying po dang / klu'i rgyal po rgya mtshos zhus pa las bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zla ba snying po dang / klu'i rgyal po rgya mtshos zhus pa las bstan pa'o //
translated: in the Candrapradipa and the Nagarakshasa-paripriccha.

original: de la dang ba'i phan yon ni /
analyzed: de la dang ba'i phan yon ni /
translated: The benefit of faith is

original: dang ba mang ba dang / 'phags pa rnams la lta 'dod pa dang dam pa'i chos nyan par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: dang ba mang ba dang / 'phags pa rnams la lta 'dod pa dang dam pa'i chos nyan par 'dod pa'o //
translated: having much faith, wanting to see the Aryas, and wanting to hear the holy Dharma.

original: yid ches pa'i phan yon ni /
analyzed: yid ches pa'i phan yon ni /
translated: The benefit of confidence is

original: las dang las kyi rnam par smin pa la yid ches pa'o //
analyzed: las dang las kyi rnam par smin pa la yid ches pa'o //
translated: and one has confidence in action and the evolution of action.

original: 'dod pa'i phan yon ni mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam spong zhing zhes bya ba la sogs @232b pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i phan yon ni mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam spong zhing zhes bya ba la sogs @232b pa ste /
translated: The benefits of desire are that one abandons the ten unwholesome courses of action, etc.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the cause of suffering.

original: mi dge ba bcu'i mtshan nyid ni 'og nas ston to //üîΩbya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa las kyang yin la /
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu'i mtshan nyid ni 'og nas ston to // bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa las kyang yin la /
translated: The characteristics of the ten unwholesome courses of action will be explained later.

original: bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro'i lam yang yin pas las kyi lam mo //
analyzed: bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro'i lam yang yin pas las kyi lam mo //
translated: They are courses of action because they are the nature of what should and should not be done, and because they are the paths to good and bad destinies.

original: phan yon dang ldan pa'i dad pa skye ba'i rim pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: phan yon dang ldan pa'i dad pa skye ba'i rim pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the order of the arising of desire endowed with benefits?

original: dang ba'i dad pa dang ldan pa dag ni yid ches par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang ba'i dad pa dang ldan pa dag ni yid ches par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who have clear faith have confidence.

original: yid ches na 'dod pa'i 'dun pa skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yid ches na 'dod pa'i 'dun pa skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: When there is confidence, the desire to be moral arises.

original: 'di ni go rims so //
analyzed: 'di ni go rims so //
translated: This is the order.

original: de'i phyir dad pa brtan par bya ba'i thabs bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir dad pa brtan par bya ba'i thabs bshad par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the means of stabilizing faith should be explained.

original: dang po mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen la gsol ba gdab par bya ste /
analyzed: dang po mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen la gsol ba gdab par bya ste /
translated: First, one should supplicate a spiritual friend who has the characteristics.

original: slob dpon khyod las bdag byang chub kyi sems bskyed par bya ba'i phyir dad pa'i rtsa ba brten pa'i thabs nod par 'tshal gyi thugs brtse ba'i slad du bstan du gsol /
analyzed: slob dpon khyod las bdag byang chub kyi sems bskyed par bya ba'i phyir dad pa'i rtsa ba brten pa'i thabs nod par 'tshal gyi thugs brtse ba'i slad du bstan du gsol /

original: des kyang rigs kyi bu dkar po'i chos mtha' dag gi rtsa ba dad pa brtan par 'dod pa ni legs so //
analyzed: des kyang rigs kyi bu dkar po'i chos mtha' dag gi rtsa ba dad pa brtan par 'dod pa ni legs so //
translated: The spiritual friend should say, Son of noble family, it is excellent that you wish to establish firm faith, the root of all virtuous qualities.

original: de'i phyir khyod kyis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang ldan pa yid la gyis shig dang / des khyod lus kyi ba spu ldang ba dang / mchi ma 'khrug pa'i dang ba nyon mongs pa med pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyod kyis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang ldan pa yid la gyis shig dang / des khyod lus kyi ba spu ldang ba dang / mchi ma 'khrug pa'i dang ba nyon mongs pa med pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, you should visualize the perfect, complete Buddha endowed with the thirty-two marks and the eighty minor marks, and by that you will generate the faith of a body with upright body hair and tears of emotion without afflictions.

original: yang na ji ltar thos pa'i rnam par yid la gyis shig dang / yang na 'phags pa'i gang zag gi tshogs kyi rnam pa de ltar yid la gyis shig dang de kho na bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na ji ltar thos pa'i rnam par yid la gyis shig dang / yang na 'phags pa'i gang zag gi tshogs kyi rnam pa de ltar yid la gyis shig dang de kho na bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, you should think about it in the way that the assembly of noble beings do, and it will be just like that.

original: de'ang rtag tu bsgom zhing brtan por bya'o zhes bya ba bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de'ang rtag tu bsgom zhing brtan por bya'o zhes bya ba bstan par bya'o //
translated: And that should be cultivated constantly and made firm.

original: yang rigs kyi bu khyod kyis 'di lta bu'i rgyu yid ches par bya ste /
analyzed: yang rigs kyi bu khyod kyis 'di lta bu'i rgyu yid ches par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, son of noble family, you should generate confidence in the cause in this way:

original: dkar po'i chos mtha' dag las skyes pa rigs kyi bu de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni chos kyi sku ste bsod nams brgya las skyes pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'og nas 'byung ba lhar yid ches pa'i dad pa bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: dkar po'i chos mtha' dag las skyes pa rigs kyi bu de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni chos kyi sku ste bsod nams brgya las skyes pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'og nas 'byung ba lhar yid ches pa'i dad pa bskyed par bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe body of the TathƒÅgata, son of noble family, is the body of Dharma, born from a hundred merits.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir khyod kyis sku 'di lta bu la 'dod pa bskyed de thob pa don du gnyer bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyod kyis sku 'di lta bu la 'dod pa bskyed de thob pa don du gnyer bar bya'o //
